intro: Psychotria apodantha, commonly known as the "white psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as tropical rainforests. Psychotria apodantha is also known for its role in traditional medicine and as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
